body_html:
what if you run with soft_device_placement=False? Also, I'm not sure where log_device_placement takes assignments from, I normally look at run_metadata to see where it gets put run_metadata = tf.RunMetadata() run_options = tf.RunOptions(trace_level=tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE) sess.run(.., options=run_options, run_metadata=run_metadata) print(run_metadata)
…

I am using tf.device to put it in the gpu, but after looking at log_device_placement, it is still pinned to CPU. DO u have any suggestion? I can upload the code if u want it. body:
what if you run with soft_device_placement=False? Also, I'm not sure where
log_device_placement takes assignments from, I normally look at
run_metadata to see where it gets put

run_metadata = tf.RunMetadata()
run_options = tf.RunOptions(trace_level=tf.RunOptions.FULL_TRACE)
sess.run(.., options=run_options, run_metadata=run_metadata)
print(run_metadata)

On Mon, Jan 23, 2017 at 7:43 PM, amortazi <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @yaroslavvb <https://github.com/yaroslavvb> thanks for response. but it
> seems that tf.pack also just runs in CPU. I am using tf.device to put it in
> the gpu, but after looking at log_device_placement, it is still pinned to
> CPU. DO u have any suggestion? I can upload the code if u want it. Thanks
>
